metadata.title: CVE-2018-12536 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In Eclipse Jetty Server, all 9.x versions, on webapps deployed usingdefault Error Handling, when an intentionally bad query arrives thatdoesn't match a dynamic url-pattern, and is eventually handled by theDefaultServlet's static file serving, the bad characters can trigger ajava.nio.file.InvalidPathException which includes the full path to the baseresource directory that the DefaultServlet and/or webapp is using. If thisInvalidPathException is then handled by the default Error Handler, theInvalidPathException message is included in the error response, revealingthe full server path to the requesting system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jetty9 - 9.2.25-1
libjetty9-extra-java - 9.2.25-1
libjetty9-java - 9.2.25-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jetty9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.2.25-1').
